item.title: The Efilist
item.description: In online spaces, people generally think of efilism as a death cult obcessed with extinction of all life. It is often conflated with promortalism, which is a related term and is itself prone to misunderstanding. I consider this unfortunate. Worse still, among such people are antinatalists who are quick to disassociate themselves with efilists who they consider to be perhaps the right target of the “dangerous philosophy” label that society gives to antinatalism.
